results.title: VD attack plan
results.creator_credit: Les Clark and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description:
An animation from the Disney studios dealing with venereal disease; its causes, effects and methods of prevention and treatment.
Suitable for upper primary, secondary and teacher/tertiary levels.

results.title: VD
results.creator_credit: Richard Leacock and Holt, Rinehart and Winston
results.brief_description: The film was shot in cinema verite style at an information centre, a school and venereal disease clinics. Symptoms and treatment are explained as actual patients visit clinics. Discussion between patients and physicians emphasise a person’s responsibility to themselves and to others if there is a possibility of infection.

results.title: Vaudeville
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Jane Ballantyne and Joanna Stewart
results.brief_description: Extraordinary people and extraordinary performances are the soul of this documentary, an entertainment special about our inherent fascination with the comic and the unusually skilled. Fire-eating presenter Mic Conway links the colourful reminiscences of the last of Australia’s vaudeville veterans - song and dance man Charles Norman; Contortionist Valantyne, Napier; “Australia’s Queen of the Air”, Olga Varona; and “Patterologist” Ron Shand. Using rare archival films of acts from the turn of the century, this film will leave you with a positive feeling about yourself, other people and the world at large.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mario Andreacchio, Jane Ballantyne and Joanna Stewart

results.title: Varley (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Allan Wargon, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A portrait of Frederick Varley, Canadian painter of the Group of Seven. Following Varley as he returns to his studio in Toronto after a sketching trip in the country, the camera moves about the studio selecting examples of his work which typify his sensitive reaction to the world about him - reactions particularly evident in the work he did as a World War I artist and in his emotional response to the beauty and wonder of life. The film also presents a revealing glimpse of the artist as he becomes absorbed in work on a new canvas.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Allan Wargon, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB

results.title: Variety. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Paul Killiam, Saul J. Turell and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
An edited version for the History of the Motion Picture series of the German film “Variety” produced by Ufa and directed by E.A. Dupont in 1925. The revolutionary photographic techniques of this important and influential German film had a profound effect on filmmaking everywhere. A strong stark drama of human passions set against a circus and vaudeville background. It is generally considered to be the best film of both its star, Emil Jannings, and its director, E.A. Dupont. Silent film with music and story line narration added.

results.title: Variety reduction
results.brief_description: The posibilities of discontinuing production of their more popular and uneconomic articles, as a means of reducing production costs, are discussed by the executives of a manufacturing concern. Sales and production staff put forward feasible arguments, in human and commercial terms, for and against the proposition; eventually a compromise is reached as all agree that a policy of selective production will ultimately market better and cheaper goods and ensure quicker delivery.
